glsa.title: BIND: Incorrect signature verification
glsa.synopsis: Incomplete verification of RSA and DSA certificates might lead to spoofed records authenticated using DNSSEC.

background.p: ISC BIND is the Internet Systems Consortium implementation of the Domain Name System (DNS) protocol.

description.p: BIND does not properly check the return value from the OpenSSL functions to verify DSA (CVE-2009-0025) and RSA (CVE-2009-0265) certificates.

impact.p: A remote attacker could bypass validation of the certificate chain to spoof DNSSEC-authenticated records.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
